other_tests.findings: Slight, verrucous, epidermal hyperplasia with mild hyperkeratosis, hypergranulosis, and necrotic keratinocytes. Inflammatory infiltration at the dermoepidermal junction mainly composed of lymphocytes, with scattered eosinophils.
Normal male chromosome complement (46,XY); 30 cells analyzed.
185 (92.5%) showed one X chromosome and one Y chromosome; 13 (6.5%) showed two X chromosomes and one Y chromosome, indicating low-level XXY mosaicism.
No mutations identified in the NEMO gene.
